1 A LAMP FOR OUR STEPS

 

A LAMP FOR OUR STEPS has been given,

a light has been set on a hill;

God's Word in its truth may be trusted,

by all who surrender their will.

 

To order the chaos of darkness, give hope in the midst of despair,

to make of our lives new creations and lighten the burdens we bear.

 

Lord, grant to us eyes ever watchful, and ears ever open to hear

the Word that in love you are speaking, the Word that dispels all our fear.

 

Your death-resurrection has claimed us,

But pardon our flesh that is weak;

You know that our spirits are willing,

give strength with the Word that you speak.

 

 

 

(Home)
2 A NEW COMMANDMENT

 

A NEW COMMANDMENT I give unto you

that you love one another as I have loved you [2]

 

By this shall all know that you are my disciples

If you have love one for another.

True love is patient, not arrogant or boastful;

Love bears all things, love is eternal.

 

I am the true Vine, my Father is the Gard'ner,

Abide in me: you will be fruitful.

You are my friends now, no longer are you servants

I chose you all. You did not choose me.

 

 

(Home)
3 ABBA-FATHERÂ 

 

ABBA-FATHER, let us be yours and yours alone;

Set our hearts, our spirits free, make us, Lord, your own.

 

Through your goodness, Lord we bring

Bread of our labour and wine to cheer the heart.

Which will soon be filled for us with the life of your Son

 

Take this drop of water too,

Sign of our weakness yet symbol of our love.

By its mingling may we share your divinity.

 

(Home)
4 ABIDE WITH ME

 

ABIDE WITH ME fast falls the eventide.

The darkness deepens; Lord, with me abide!

When other helpers fail and comforts flee,

Help of the helpless, Lord, abide with me.

 

Swift to its close ebbs out life's little day:

Earth's joys grow dim, its glories pass away;

Change and decay in all around I see;

O thou who changest not, abide with me.

 

Hold thou thy Cross before my closing eyes

Shine through the gloom and point me to the skies

Heav'n's morning breaks and earth's vain shadows flee:

In life, in death, O Lord, abide with me.

 

(Home)
5 AH! LORD GOD

 

AH! LORD GOD, you have made the heavens

and the earth by your great power.

Ah! Lord God, you have made the heavens

and the earth by your outstretched arm.

 

Nothing is too difficult for you, [2]

O great and mighty God.

Great in counsel and mighty in deed, mighty in deed,

Nothing, nothing, absolutely nothing,

Nothing is too difficult for you.

 

You bring back exiles to their homeland

and you call them your own people.

You bring back exiles to their homeland

and you make a new covenant.

 

In your love Jesus has redeemed us

by his death and resurrection.

In your love Jesus has redeemed us,

He has nailed all our sins to the tree.

 

 

(Home)
6 ALL I ASK OF YOU

 

ALL I ASK OF YOU

is forever to remember me as loving you.

 

Deep the joy of being together in one heart and

for me that's just where it is.

 

As we make our way through all the joys and pain,

can we sense our younger truer selves?

 

Someone will be calling you to be there for a while:

can you hear his cry from deep within?

 

Laughter joy and friendship, the only gifts you are!

Have you time? I'd like to be with you.

 

 

(Home)
7 ALL OVER THE WORLD

 

ALL OVER THE WORLD the Spirit is moving,

All over the world, as the prophet said it would be,

All over the world there's a mighty revelation

Of the glory of the Lord as the waters cover the sea

 

ii. Deep down in my heart...

iii. All over the Church...

 

(Home)

 
8 ALL PEOPLES OF THE UNIVERSE

 

ALL PEOPLES OF THE UNIVERSE

Sing to the Lord with cheerful voice,

Him loudly praise and gladly serve,

Into his presence come with song.

 

Know that the Lord is God indeed,

He made us we belong to him;

We all on earth his people are,

The flock he tends the sheep he owns.

 

O enter then his gates with praise,

These courts of his approach with joy,

Give thanks to him who reigns on high

And bless his ever holy name.

 

(Home)

 

 
9 ALL THE EARTH PROCLAIM

 

ALL THE EARTH PROCLAIM the Lord,

Sing your praise to God

 

Worship the Lord, hearts filled with gladness

Come into his presence singing for joy.

 

Enter his gates bringing thanksgiving

O enter his courts while singing his praise.

 

(Home)

 
10 ALL TO JESUS I SURRENDER

 

ALL TO JESUS I SURRENDER, all to him I freely give,

I will ever love and trust him, in his presence daily live.

 

I surrender all, I surrender all,

All to thee, my blessed Saviour, I surrender all.

 

All to Jesus I surrender: Lord, I want to follow thee,

Lose my life that I may save it, through thy Cross gain victory.

 

All to Jesus I surrender, born of Mary, God's own Son,

Through this Eucharistic banquet, make me Jesus, with thee one.

 

All to Jesus I surrender; may I see thee in the poor,

In the fight against oppression let me never thee ignore.

 

(Home)
11 ALL YOU WHO LABOUR

 

ALL YOU WHO LABOUR, come and rest awhile,

You who are burdened all the day and long;

Wipe from your brow the sweat and dust of toil

And with my Resurrection pow'r be strong.

 

O come and rest: the journey is too great

And you may faint along the way and sink;

The bread of life is here for you to eat

And here for you the wine of love to drink.

 

Come, tell me all that you have done and said:

Your victories and failures, hopes and fears;

My passion and my rising from the dead

Will bring you peace and wipe away your tears.

 

(Home)

 
12 AMAZING GRACE

 

AMAZING GRACE! How sweet the sound

That saved a wretch like me.

I once was lost but now I'm found, was blind but now I see.

 

'Twas grace that taught my heart to fear and grace my fears relieved.

How precious did that grace appear, the hour I first believed.

 

The Lord has promised good to me. his word my hope secures,

He will my shield, my portion be, as long as life endures.

 

(Home)

 

 
13 APOSTLE OF THE INDIAN LAND

 

APOSTLE OF THE INDIAN LAND

St. Francis, guide us by the hand.

The faith thou didst to India give help us in turn to preach and live. [2]

 

Despising all the world's vain show and all that riches can bestow

Thou chosest as the path of God, the thorny way our Saviour trod. [2]

 

(Home)

 
14 AS THE DEER Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â 

 

AS THE DEER that pants for water, so my soul longs after you.

You alone are my heart's desire and I long to worship you.

 

You alone are my strength, my shield,

To you alone may my spirit yield.

You alone are my heart's desire

and I long to worship you.

 

I want you more than gold and silver, only you can satisfy.

You alone are the true joy-giver and the apple of my eye.

 

You are mine, yes, you are my Brother even though you are a King.

I love you more than any other and much more than anything.

 

 

(Home)
15 AS WE GATHER

 

 

R1 AS WE GATHER may your Spirit work within us

As we gather may we glorify your name

Knowing well that as our hearts begin to worship

We'll be blest because we came [2]

 

R 2 I saw living water flowing from the Temple,

Blood and water flowing from his open side,

Bringing us the life of God and his salvation

And the people sang in joyful praise: "Allelu, alleluia"!

 

We are people born of water and the Spirit

We are people come to celebrate God's love

We have come to hear the Word, we have come to share the Bread,

We have come to sing our praises to God above.

 

We are sons and daughters of the Resurrection

"Alleluia" is the song we sing with joy;

When we pray in Jesus' name, "Abba Father" we proclaim

And his Holy Spirit fills us with words of praise.

 

(Home)

 

 
16 AT THE CROSS

 

AT THE CROSS her station keeping,

Stood the mournful mother weeping, close to Jesus to the last.

 

Through her heart his sorrow sharing

All his bitter anguish bearing, now at length the sword has pass'd.

 

Can the human heart refrain

From partaking in her pain, in that mother's pain untold.

 

(Home)

 

 
17 AT THE NAME OF JESUS Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â 

 

AT THE NAME OF JESUS ev'ry knee shall bow

Ev'ry tongue confess him, King of glory now;

 

Though he was truly God, he became a slave.

And in this emptiness, all our sins did lave.

 

Obedient unto death, on the cross of pain,

He was exalted when he rose again.

 

It is God's hoiy will that we call him Lord

Who is the First and Last, and the mighty Word.

 

(Home)

 

 
18 AT THIS TIME OF GIVING

 

AT THIS TIME OF GIVING gladly now we bring

Gifts that have been given by our God and King.

 

Here is our bread of pain, work of human hands

This is the bread of joy, we will share in love.

 

See, Lord, this joyous wine harvested from earth,

This is our wine of love, ready for the feast.

 

(Home)
19 BE EXALTED

 

BE EXALTED, O God above the heavens

Let thy glory be over all the earth [2]

 

I will give thanks to thee, O Lord, among the people,

I will sing praises to thee among the nations

For thy steadfast love is great, is great to the heavens

and thy faithfulness, thy faithfulness to the clouds.

 

It is good to thank you, Lord and to praise your name with music;

to proclaim your love and mercy in the morning.

For your deeds have made me glad, at your works I shout in triumph.

Lord, how wonderful and how marvellous are your designs.

 

All your creatures thank you Lord and your friends repeat their blessing.

Age to age proclaim your splendour and your glory

You are kind to us, O God, full of tender love and mercy,

and your graciousness and your constancy have no compare.

 

(Home)

21 BE STILL, MY SOUL

 

BE STILL, MY SOUL, the Lord is on your side:

Bear patiently the cross of grief and pain. For family

Leave to your God to order and provide; of deceased

in ev'ry change he faithful will remain.

 

Be still, my soul, your God will undertake

to guide the future, as he has the past.

Your hope, your confidence, let nothing shake,

All that is cloudy shall be clear at last.

 

Be still, my soul, the tempests still obey

his voice, who ruled them once in Galilee.

Jesus is near: your best, your heav'nly friend

through stormy ways leads to a joyful end.

 

 

(Home)
22 BE WITH US, MARY

 

BE WITH US, MARY, along the way, guide ev'ry step we take.

Lead us to Jesus your loving Son.

Come with us Mary, come.

 

No one can live as an island, journeying through life alone

Since we're most loved by a mother, Jesus gave us his own.

 

When Jesus met with rejection, Mary stood by the cross;

How can a mother desert her son? She'll also stand by us.

 

Help us, O star of the ocean, be with us in our strife,

When we are faced with temptation, toss'd by the storms of life.

 

Often enough in life's banquet we shall run short of wine

Then as at Cana, request your Son to make our life divine.

 

(Home)

 
23 BEGINNING TODAY

 

BEGINNING TODAY my mornings are yours,

The hopes that dawn in their light.

Beginning today my evenings and dreams:

My gift to you is my life.

 

I will always remember the time you first called me

Out of my empty sleep

To waken in me the hope of a new day:

The love I wanted to seek.

 

You gave me your life, Lord, as sign of the springtime

Beginning in me each day.

You made me a person with wonder and love, Lord,

To newly discover your way.

 

I promise this day I will sing for the world

The song we begin to share

To fill up tomorrow with sounds of our love, Lord,

The hopes and dreams that we bear.

 

(Home)

 

 
24 BIND US TOGETHERÂ Â Â Â Â Â Â Â 

 

BIND US TOGETHER, Lord, bind us together

with cords that cannot be broken... with love.

 

There is only one God, there is only one King,

There is only one Body, that is why we sing:

There is only one Faith, there is only one Lord,

There is only one Spirit, that is why we sing.

 

(Home)

 
25 BLESS THE LORD

 

BLESS THE LORD, O my soul [2]

And all that is within me bless his holy name.

He's my Way forever, alleluia [3]

He's my Way for evermore. [2. Truth; 3. Life]

 

 

(Home)
26 BLESSED ARE THEY

 

BLESSED ARE THEY who are poor in spirit,

theirs is the kingdom of God.

Happy the people who mourn in sorrow,

they will find peace and joy.

 

We are the sign of God's love,

May our lives proclaim more than words.

May those who see our deeds be inspired

To give glory to God.

 

Blessed are they who are meek and humble, they will inherit the earth.

Happy the people who work for justice, they shall receive their fill.

 

Blessed are they who bring God's compassion,

mercy will they receive.

Happy are they who are single-minded, they will behold God's face.

 

When people slander or victimize you, yours is the kingdom of God.

And for my sake when they falsely blame you,

know your reward is great.

 

(Home)

 
27 BLESSED BE GOD FOR EVER!

 

BLESSED BE GOD FOR EVER! [to be repeated after every line]

Blest are you, O Lord, God of all creation [Blessed be...]

Take this bread/cup a sign of our self-oblation,

II's the fruit of earth and the work of hands,

To be now transformed at your Word's command.

 

Whenever we're together in fair or stormy weather,

Oh we can't go wrong if we sing our song: [Blessed be...]

 

(Home)

 

 
28 BLESSING AND HONOUR

 

BLESSING AND HONOUR and glory and pow'r,

Wisdom and riches and strength evermore,

Give we to him who our battle has won:

The Lamb who now' sits on the throne.

 

Glory, honour and praise to you Jesus

Your life-giving Word sets us free;

Your death-resurrection has made us one,

To you be the victory!

 

Ever ascending the song and the prayer;

Ever descending his love that we share.

Sing we the song of the Lamb that was slain,

Who rising, in vict'ry now reigns

 

(Home)

 
29 BLEST ARE YOU, LORD

 

BLEST ARE YOU, LORD, God of all creation

Thanks to your goodness, this bread [wine] we offer,

Fruit of the earth [vine], work of our hands:

It will become the bread of life [our cup of joy].

Blessed be God [2] blessed be God for ever, Amen. [2]

 

(Home)
30 BLEST BE THE TIE

 

BLEST BE THE TIE binding two hearts

As man and wife, until death do them part.

Such kindred minds, God made them signs:

Sign of Christ's gift to his Bride from the Cross.

 

Good times or bad, in sickness or health,

For better, for worse, with little or wealth,

See now they promise ever to be faithful,

Loyal and true, all the days of their life.

 

Look on this bride, O Father of all.

Your blessing she asks, your grace, love and peace.

Lord, may her husband treat her as his equal,

Honour and love her as Christ loves his Church.

 

Keep them for ever true to your law,

Examples to all, a mark of your love.

Give them the strength which comes from the gospel,

Fullness of life in your kingdom, O Lord.

 

(Home)

 
31 BREAD THAT WAS SOWN

 

BREAD THAT WAS SOWN in our hills and valleys

Now harvested becomes one; Unity

From all the world gather your people, O God,

Into your kingdom of love. [To end add: of your love]

[You may sing appropriate verses without returning to refrain]

 

Father, your name is written deep inside us,

Giving us immortality,

Life and knowledge, revealed through your Word:

Jesus, your Servant and Son. [To end add: Christ, your Son].

 

Leaven and wheat, so let us be for others,

Nurturing good with earnest care,

Bringing to birth new life where hope has gone stale,

Faith-giving moments to share. [To end add: faith to share].

 

We give you thanks, O Lord, for you are mighty

With bread and wine you give us strength

Food for our spirit you give through your Son:

To him be glory evermore. [To end add: ev-er-more].

36 COLOURS OF DAY

 

COLOURS OF DAY dawn into the mind,

The sun has come up, the night is behind.

Go down in the city, into the street

And let's give the message to the people we meet.

 

So light up the fire and let the flame burn

Open the door, let Jesus return.

Take seeds of his Spirit, let the fruit grow,

Tell the people of Jesus, let his love show.

 

Go through the park, on into the town

The sun still shines on, it never goes down.

The light of the world is risen again;

The people of darkness are needing a friend.

 

Open your eyes, look into the sky,

The darkness has come, the sun came to die,

The evening draws on, the sun disappears;

But Jesus is living and his Spirit is near.

47 DEEP, DEEP IN THE HUMAN HEART

 

DEEP, DEEP IN THE HUMAN HEART

The fire of justice burns

A vision of a world renewed by radical concern.

 

As Christians we are called to set the captive free.

to overthrow the evil powers and end hypocrisy.

 

This, this is our task today, to build a world of peace

A world of freedom, justice, truth, where kindness will increase.

 

Free, free us from selfishness, teach us at last to share,

To banish hunger from the earth, let every person care

 

Lord, give us the grace to work as one community

To bring new hope and fuller life to all humanity

 

Lord, taking the step of faith, we leave the past behind

And move into the future's world with open heart and mind.

Even though my sins are many, all my trust in him I place.

84 HAIL QUEEN OF HEAVEN

 

HAIL QUEEN OF HEAVEN, the ocean Star

Guide of the wanderer here below

Thrown on life's surge, we claim thy care

Save us from peril and from woe.

Mother of Christ, Star of the sea,

Pray for the wanderer, pray for me. [2]

 

O valiant woman, steadfast maid,

See how the Lord has done marvels for thee,

Through Jesus your Son, you gave our world,

Justice and truth and Iiberty

Hope of the weak, Star of the sea,

Pray for the needy, pray for me. [2]

85 HAND IN HAND WITH CHRIST

 

HAND IN HAND WITH CHRIST, our brother, his love we'll show

We will rise and leave the house of God: to all we'll go.

 

Grant, O Lord, that we may journey on the way that was your own

For our neighbours ever caring, in the way you've shown.

 

Let all petty strife be banished teach us all the way of peace,

So that living as one family, all our fears may cease.

 

With the fire of love now burning by your Spirit's pow'r made strong,

Give us strength to spread your message and proclaim your truth

 

 

(Home)

 
86 HAPPINESS IS WHERE YOU ARE

 

HAPPINESS IS WHERE YOU ARE and what you want to be,

If you look you're sure to find the rainbow of your dreams

Tomorrow's fuller than a thousand yesterdays

With the vision of a new day in your heart.

 

If the clouds should darken you may turn your hopes on high

Sorrow isn't meant to shake you from your way of life,

Just keep on looking for the answer to it all

With the vision of a new day in your heart.

 

Happy those who make the Word of God their very own,

Truth and sincerity will be their only home.

Look to the stars and find a reason to believe

With the vision of a new day in your heart.

 

 

(Home)

 
87 HAPPY ARE THE POOR IN SPIRIT

 

HAPPY ARE THE POOR IN SPIRIT,

they are children of the kingdom.

Blessed the pure of heart for they shall see the glory of the Lord.

Happy those who mourn in sorrow

for the Lord will send them comfort

Blessed those who thirst for holiness,

for they shall drink and have their fill.

 

Rejoice, rejoice and be gladsome, exult, exult leap for joy

Your reward is great in heaven: Be gladsome and rejoice.

 

Happy are the meek and humble:

yes, the earth they will inherit.

Blest the merciful for God will grant to them his mercy.

Happy, happy the peacemakers

for they live as God's own children

Blessed those who work for justice:

the kingdom of heaven is theirs.

 

 

(Home)

 
88 HAPPY THE HEART

 

HAPPY THE HEART that lives in the heart of God: the heart of love;

Happy the heart that learns to love with the love of God.

 

+ God is love, love your God, with the love he gave in Christ.

+ We must love, love everyone with a love that comes from God.

+ Spirit of love, love in us, that our joy may be complete.

HAVE THINE OWN WAY, Lord, have thine own way

Thou art the Potter, I am the clay.

90 HE IS LORD, HE IS LORD!

 

HE IS LORD, HE IS LORD!

He is risen from the dead and he is Lord!

Ev'ry knee shall bow, ev'ry tongue confess

That Jesus Christ is Lord.

 

Have this mind among yourselves, the mind of Jesus

Even though he was eternally God's Son,

He emptied himself to be the servant of all,

He was humble and obedient unto death.

 

He is seated at the right hand of the Father,

God put ev'rything he made under his feet.

He has given to him the highest name that can be named

And in all believing hearts he reigns supreme.

 

May your inward eye, your vision be illumined,

May you know what is the hope that waits for you;

For the glory God offers you as your inheritance

Was displayed when he raised Jesus from the dead.

His majesty indeed fills the earth.

And made him shed his blood for our sake.

93 HELP US ACCEPT EACH OTHER

 

HELP US ACCEPT EACH OTHER as Christ accepted us.

Teach us as sister, brother, each person to embrace.

Be present, Lord, among us and bring us to believe

We are ourselves accepted and meant to love and live.

 

Jesus, Lamb of God, have mercy on us!

Jesus, bearer of our sins, have mercy on us!

Jesus, redeemer of the world, grant your people peace.

Help us accept each other that we may love and live.

94 HERE I AM, LORD

 

HERE I AM, LORD, I am Iist'ning,

I have heard you call me by my name.

Keep me open to your word, Lord,

May you pour on me your Spirit's flame.

 

Feed the hungry at your door, share your clothing with the poor

Then at last your light will shine, your wounds will heal.

Break the yoke of the oppressed, take the homeless as your guest

In the darkness of their night, you be the light.

 

Strive to set all captives free, end their pain and misery

And the spring of life within will never fail.

Lift your eyes and look around; see that justice soon be found

And the glory of the Lord will be your guard

 

I, the Lord of sea and sky: I have heard my people cry

All who dwell in dark and sin, my hand will save.

I who made the stars of night, I will make their darkness bright.

Who will bear my light to them? Whom shall I send?

 

 

(Home)

 
95 HIDE ME

 

HIDE ME in the hollow of your loving hand

Where the foe may not pursue, nor the traitor stand

There without anxiety or a trace of grief

Calmed from ev'ry tension, I will find relief.

 

Jesus is my Refuge, Jesus is my Saviour,

Jesus is my Hiding Place: Lord, I trust in you.

 

All the joys and sorrows strewn upon my patl1,

Death-resurrection traced upon my heart,

I will now accept because I live in you

And your Spirit fills me, builds my life anew.

 

Flood my life with peace and your serenity

Like a silent pool I'll live in tranquillity;

So that I may flow to others every day,

Like a river growing deeper all the way.

they shall bear much fruit. .

pondering his Word by day and night.

Just like a tree that's planted by the water,

we shall bear much fruit.

 

Our joy is in the statutes of the Lord,

as night and day we ponder on the Word.

Just like a tree that's planted by the water,

we shall bear much fruit.

Enter his gates with thanks.

Come let us worship and bend low, into his presence come!

We are his sheep, marked with his seal,

Faithful his love endures.

And may his touch warm up our hearts,

106 I DARE NOT SING

 

I DARE NOT SING of Jesus' pain and anguish,

when he was crowned with thorns and mocked with jeers;

of scourge and nails, of blood and water flowing

of death that crowned his three and thirty years.

But "II proclaim he heals our broken spirits,

he takes away our sin and calms our fear

and lifts the burden from the heavy-laden.

Look to the Cross, the Saviour of the world is here!

 

There from the Cross can Jesus win the nations?

Did God bequea'th a curse or heritage?

Will Jesus meet the needs and aspirations

Of east and west, of sinner and of sage?

Of this I'm sure, all flesh will see his glory,

the grain that fell will yield a hundredfold,

when Christ, the Rising Sun, will shine in splendour.

Acclaim the Cross where Jesus died with love untold.

Within your gates, O Jerusalem.

It is there that the tribes now gather,

All the tribes to worship the Lord

 

For the peace of Jerusalem pray:

Prosperity to all your dwelling places.

Let there be peace everywhere within your ramparts,

Let there be safety within your towers.

 

For the love of my family and my friends,

This is my prayer: "May lasting peace be yours".

For the sake of the house of the Lord,

I shall plead and pray for your good.

Ref 2 Eternal rest grant to (them) O Lord

I will never forget my own!

114 IF YOU WISH TO BE MY DISCIPLE

 

IF YOU WISH TO BE MY DISCIPLE,

Take up your cross and follow me.

 

i. The foxes have their holes, the birds their nests.

But I have not a place to take my rest.

 

ii. Whoever loves his life will only lose it.

It's only sacrifice that brings one gain.

 

iii. All you who labour come, you who are burdened,

Take up my yoke as well - and you'll find rest.

 

iv. The one who holds the plough and looks behind,

My kingdom cannot serve, my peace won't find.

 

v. A servant surely is less than his master;

If they have hated me, they will hate you.

 

vi. So let your loins be girt, your lamps a-burning,

And be like those who wait for my return.

 

vii. You who have followed me, when life is ended

Will reap a hundredfold eternally.

Where, O death, where is your power to hurt?

For the Lord has conquered sin and death,

By his cross we are made free.

Fervent in spirit may I live, steadfast through all my days.

126 IT TAKES COURAGE

 

IT TAKES COURAGE to answer a call,

It takes courage to give your all.

It takes courage to risk your name,

It takes courage to be true.

 

It takes courage to dare what no other would share,

To be standing alone, one whom no one will own,

To be ready to stake, to be loyal not fake,

It takes courage to be true.

 

It takes courage to say what you know will not pay,

To give each one a share though there'll be less to spare,

To be seeking no more than the neighbour next door,

It takes courage to be true.

 

It takes courage to leave what good fortune can give,

And to go to a land where the poor need a hand

To be spending one's' days in less leisurely ways,

It takes courage to be true.

we'll thank him that the times we loved on earth, was time well spent.

our prayer helped us anticipate the vision of his face.

Ev'ry valley may he fill, level ev'ry mount and hill.

335 THE DAY OF THE LORD

 

THE DAY OF THE LORD shall come as prophets foretold

When Christ shall make all things new, no matter how old,

And some at the stars may gaze and some at God's word

In vain to predict the time, the Day of the Lord.

 

Come, Lord Jesus, make no delay,

Come, Lord Jesus, light up our way!

 

The Day of the Lord shall come, a thief in the night;

A curse to those in the wrong who think they are right,

A pleasure for those in pain with death at the door,

A true liberation for the prisoners and poor.

 

The desert shall spring to life, the hills shall rejoice;

The lame of the earth shall leap, the dumb find their voice,

The lamb with the lion shall lie, the last shall be first,

And nations for war no more shall study or thirst.

 

The Day of the Lord shall come but now is the time,

To topple earth's wisdom with Christ's folly sublime,

By loving the loveless, turning the tide and the cheek,

By walking beneath the cross in step with the weak.

Children come to the children's King.

Sing, sing, chorus of angels,

Stars of morning, o'er Bethlehem sing.

 

He lies 'mid the beasts of the stall, who is Maker and Lord of us all.

The wintry wind blows cold and dreary, see, he weeps the world is weary.

Lord, have pity and mercy on me.

 

He leaves all his glory behind, to be born and to die for mankind

With grateful beasts his cradle chooses, thankless man his love refuses.

Lord, have pity and mercy on me.

 

To the manger of Bethlehem come, to the Saviour Emmanuel's home;

The heav'nly hosts above are singing, set the Christmas bells a-ringing.

Lord, have pity and mercy on me.

 

 

 

 

(Home)
345 GOD REST YOU

GOD REST YOU people, gathered here, let nothing you dismay;

Remember Christ our Saviour was born on Christmas day!

To save us all from Satan's pow'r when we were gone astray.

 

O tidings of comfort and joy, comfort and joy

O tidings of comfort and joy.

 

From God our heav'nly Father, a blessed angel came;

And unto certain shepherds, brought tidings of the same:

How that in Bethlehem was born, the Son of God by name.

 

"Fear not, then" said the angel, "Let nothing you affright;

This day is born a Saviour, of a pure Virgin bright,

To free all those who trust in him, from Satan's pow'r and might.

 

Now to the Lord sing praises, all you within this place,

And with true love and fellowship, each other now embrace;

This holy tide of Christmas, doth bring redeeming grace.

 

 

 

 

(Home)
346 HARK, THE HERALD ANGELS SING

HARK, THE HERALD ANGELS SING glory to the new-born King

Peace on earth and mercy mild, God and sinners reconciled.

Joyful all ye nations rise, join the triumph of the skies

With th'angelic hosts proclaim, Christ is born in Bethlehem

 

Hark the herald angels sing, glory to the new-born King.

 

Hail eternal Prince of Peace! Hail, a Son of Righteousness!

Light of life to all he brings, ris'n with healing in his wings;

Now he lays his glory by, so that we may no more die,

Born to raise us all from earth, born to give us second birth.

 

 

 

 

(Home)
347 IT CAME UPON A MIDNIGHT CLEAR

IT CAME UPON A MIDNIGHT CLEAR that glorious song of praise;

A multitude of heaven's host their angel voices raised:

"Peace on earth, good will to all, from heaven's gracious King".

The world in solemn stillness lay to hear the angels sing.

 

See how the days are hast'ning on towards the end of time

When with the ever-circling years will come your reign divine;

Joyfully we wait in hope, till you make all things new;

And we redeemed give back the hymn which now the angels sing.

 

 

 

 

(Home)
348 JOY TO THE WORLD

 

JOY TO THE WORLD, the Lord is come, let earth receive her king.

Let ev'ry heart prepare him room and heaven and nature sing.

 

Joy to the world, the Saviour reigns, let all their songs employ

While fields and floods, rocks hills and plains, repeat their sounding joy.

 

No more let sin and sorrow grow, nor thorns infest the ground.

He comes to make his blessings flow far as the curse is found.

 

He rules the world with truth and grace and makes the nations prove

The glories of his righteousness and wonders of his love.

 

 

 

 

(Home)
349 LONG TIME AGO

 

LONG TIME AGO in Bethlehem, in a manger, poor and small

Mary's Boy Child Jesus Christ was born to die for all.

Hark, now hear the angels sing: "A new King's born today

"That we may live forevermore because of Christmas Day".

Trumpets sound and angels sing listen to what they say"

350 O COME ALL YE FAITHFUL, joyful and triumphant

O come ye, a come ye, to Bethlehem

Come and behold him born the King of angels:

 

O come let us adore him, [3) Christ the Lord!

 

Sing, choirs of angels, sing in exultation

Sing all ye citizens of heaven above

Glory to God, glory in the highest.

 

Lord Jesus, we greet thee, born this happy morning.

a Saviour, to thee be given glory and praise.

Word of the Father, now in flesh appearing!

 

 

 

 

(Home)
351 O LITTLE TOWN

O LITTLE TOWN of Bethlehem, how still we see thee lie;

Above thy deep and dreamless sleep, the silent stars go by.

Yet in thy dark streets shineth the everlasting Light;

The hopes and fears of all the years are met in thee tonight.

 

For Christ is born of Mary and gathered all above,

while mortals sleep, the angels keep their watch of wond'ring love.

a shining stars together proclaim the holy birth;

And praises sing to God the King and peace to all on earth.
